events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under the Auto Accident cluster due to the involvement of the insured vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage communications and process the claim efficiently.
The claimant received confirmation that the accident claim was acknowledged and under active review.
The insurance company requested installation of damage photos, police report, and repair estimates to proceed further.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the collision photos, police report, and car repair quotes.
The investigation team commenced review of submitted materials to verify details and assess liability for the accident.
Investigation concluded confirming that the accident was caused by third-party driver negligence and damages are covered.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering vehicle repair costs and associated expenses.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim.
The insurance claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement proposal by the claimant.
Payment was successfully issued to the claimantâ€™s appointed repair shop to cover all vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was formally closed after confirming completion of repairs and receipt of payment by the policyholder.
All claim documents and communications were archived for record keeping and future reference if needed.
